title: Ticket #5912: Condor_submit should have syntax for job retries
description:
condor_submit should have first class keywords to describe job retries, and it should automatically generate the appropriate OnExitRemove expressions in the job ad based on those keywords.

Use of one or more of the keywords below will cause an appropriate OnExitRemove expression to be added to the job ad, and possibly other attributes as well.

keywords will be one or more of

name type description
max_retries integer values > 0 should cause the job to retry N times
retry_until int or expr futility exit code, or expression that when true, causes retries to cease
success_exit_code integer exit code that will be returned on success

  • Retries will continue until the job exits with the value of success_exit_code or has exited more than max_retries times.
  • If success_exit_code is not set, then 0 will be assumed to mean success.
  • if retry_until is an integer, it is equivalent to DAGman's UNLESS-EXIT keyword. It should contain an exit code that indicates futility and retries will cease when the exit code is equal to it. If it is an expression retries will cease when it evaluates to true.
  • Use of max_retries and/or success_exit_code without max_retries will use a configuration knob to control the default retry count.
  • If an OnExitRemove expression is also defined in the submit file, that expression will be ||'ed with the expression generated for doing retries.
